marketNews.title: Sektor Properti: Kompilasi Marketing Sales 2024
marketNews.content:
Several residential property developers announced their 2024 marketing sales realizations, including Ciputra Development ($CTRA), Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI), Summarecon Agung ($SMRA), Alam Sutera Realty ($ASRI), Bangun Kosambi Sukses ($CBDK), and Pakuwon Jati ($PWON). During 2024, several issuers exceeded their marketing-sales targets, such as ASRI (113%) and PWON (104%). The issuers that met their marketing-sales targets were CTRA and PANI. Notably, PANI revised its marketing-sales target upward from IDR 5.5 trillion to IDR 6 trillion, as we had anticipated in the 1H24 analysis (see https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/sektor-properti-kompilasi-marketing-sales-1h24#:~:text=Sementara%20itu%2C%20marketing%20sales%20PANI%20berpeluang%20melebihi%20target%202024%2C%20sehingga%20perseroan%20berpotensi%20merevisi%20naik%20target%20mereka.). In contrast, the marketing-sales realizations of CBDK and SMRA fell short of their targets, reaching 82% and 87% of target respectively. Of the six issuers, two have already announced 2025 marketing-sales targets: SMRA at IDR 5 trillion (a 14.5% increase over the 2024 realization) and PWON at IDR 1.8 trillion (a 15.8% increase over the 2024 realization). 

Key Takeaway: Although 2024 was an election year, residential property developers were able to maintain or post year-on-year growth in marketing-sales. We believe the results can be linked to the 100% Value-Added Tax (PPN DTP) incentive that was in force for ten months (January-June and September-December). Several issuers reported the contribution of the PPN DTP to total marketing-sales in 2024, namely PWON at 59% and CTRA at 27%. For 2025, we assess that the positive sentiment for the sector can continue with the extension of the 100% PPN DTP until June 2025, after which the rate will fall to 50% for July-December 2025. Bloomberg consensus estimates that the BI Rate will be cut another 50 basis points, twice, to 5.25% by the end of 2025.

marketNews.title: The Fed Holds Rates Steady at 4.25%–4.5% on 29 January 2025
marketNews.content: The U.S. Federal Reserve kept its policy rate unchanged at 4.25%–4.5% at its meeting on Wednesday, 29 January, in line with consensus expectations. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank is not in a hurry to cut rates, adding that the pause is intended to assess the impact of the 2024 rate-cut cycle on inflation. Powell also noted that the U.S. economy remains strong and that rates are no longer as restrictive as before. The robust U.S. economy, together with a solid labour market, gives the Fed time to evaluate how President Donald Trump’s policies might affect the economy.

marketNews.title: Kpler Forecasts 26% MoM Drop in China Coal Imports in January 2025
marketNews.content: Kpler estimates that China’s seaborne coal imports in January 2025 fell to 27.97 million tonnes, a 26% month-on-month decline and the lowest level in almost four years. Historically, China’s coal imports usually weaken in January and February as the winter peak ends, but the estimated drop is far larger than the January 2024 decline of 9% MoM and the January 2023 decline of 10.9% MoM, pressured by higher domestic supply. The price impact was evident as Argus reported that Indonesian thermal coal (4,200 kcal/kg) traded at US$48.76 per tonne in the week to 24 January 2025, the lowest level since April 2021.

marketNews.title: Axiata Group and Sinar Mas Sign MoU to Explore 5G, Digital and Fintech Collaboration
marketNews.content: Axiata Group Berhad and Sinar Mas announced on Tuesday, 28 January, a memorandum of understanding to explore and expand strategic collaborations in digital economy growth, including 5G innovation, business solutions, digital infrastructure and fintech.

marketNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI Falls to 49.1 in January 2025
marketNews.content: China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported that the manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) fell to 49.1 in January 2025 (versus 50.1 in December 2024), below the consensus expectation of 50.1. The reading marks the first factory-sector contraction since September 2024 and the sharpest five-month decline, driven by weak factory activity ahead of the Lunar New Year. Confidence, however, rose to 55.3 (up from 53.3 in December 2024), the highest level in ten months.

marketNews.title: Honda Targets 50% Global Motorcycle Market Share
marketNews.content: Honda Motor Co. (TYO: 7267) aims to capture a 50% share of the global motorcycle market, including electric motorcycles, although the company did not disclose the time frame for achieving the target. Honda expects the sales boost to be driven by emerging markets – especially Indonesia, the Philippines, Brazil and other Latin American countries. For the fiscal year ending March 2025, Honda projects motorcycle sales of 20.2 million units, equivalent to a 40% global market share. Looking ahead, Honda forecasts the global motorcycle industry – both conventional and electric – to reach 60 million units per year by 2030.

marketNews.title: Nvidia Market Capitalisation Falls Nearly $600 Billion in One Day
marketNews.content: Nvidia (Nasdaq: NVDA) saw its market capitalisation shrink by almost US$600 billion on Monday, 27 January, marking the largest one-day market-cap decline in U.S. history. The sell-off was triggered by concerns that Chinese start-up DeepSeek has intensified global AI competition. At the end of December 2024, DeepSeek launched a free open-source AI model that the company claims can be developed in two months at a cost of less than US$6 million and runs on Nvidia’s low-capacity H800 chip.

tickerNews.title: JPFA Announces Parent Company Japfa Ltd. to Go Private and Delist from SGX
tickerNews.content: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia announced that the ultimate beneficial owners, the Santosa family, intend to acquire the remaining shareholding in the JPFA parent company, Japfa Ltd. (SGX: JAP). The corporate action will lead to the delisting of Japfa Ltd. from the Singapore exchange. The transaction will not change JPFA’s shareholder composition; Japfa Ltd. will remain the group’s parent and the Santosa family will continue as the ultimate beneficial owners.

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Joint Venture Seeks $1 Billion Sustainability-Linked Loan
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the joint venture between Chandra Asri Pacific and Glencore plc, CAPGC Pte. Ltd., is seeking a US$1 billion sustainability-linked syndicated loan with an average tenor of 6.3 years. The loan is intended for Aster Chemicals & Energy, a new entity under CAPGC Pte. Ltd., and will be used for general corporate purposes. Bloomberg said DBS Bank Ltd. and Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp. are the arrangers. Glencore declined to comment, and TPIA has not responded to Bloomberg’s request for comment. In 2024, CAPGC Pte. Ltd. acquired the entire ownership of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) from Shell Singapore Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Targets 13–15 tonnes of Gold Bars in 2025
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi’s directors, Thendra Crisnanda, said the company aims to sell 13–15 tonnes of gold bars in 2025 (versus the 2024 target of 9 tonnes), with projected revenue and net-profit growth of roughly +50–60% YoY and +40–50% YoY respectively. To achieve the goal, HRTA plans to open 15 new stores in 2025, expand export markets and forge strategic partnerships. The company currently operates more than 1,000 points of sale, including 85 Hartadinata-branded stores. HRTA will allocate IDR 125 billion in capex for 2025, up from IDR 80 billion in 2024, to fund plant integration and new machinery.

tickerNews.title: RATU: Director Sells 150,000 Shares at IDR 6,000 Each
tickerNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu’s President Director Alexandra Sinta Wahjudewanti sold 150,000 RATU shares at an average price of IDR 6,000 per share on 22 January 2025, for a total transaction value of IDR 900 million. After the transaction, Alexandra’s ownership fell from 0.0073% to 0.0018% of the company’s shares.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Secures IDR 978 Billion Credit from BNI
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital, through its subsidiary PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem (Weave), obtained a credit facility of IDR 978 billion from Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI). WIFI’s President Director Yune Marketatmo said the facility will be used to build high-speed (up to 100 Mbps) internet networks for 40 million households on Java.

tickerNews.title: HEAL: Director Purchases 900,000 Shares at IDR 1,500
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina’s President Director Hasmoro bought 900,000 HEAL shares at an average price of IDR 1,500 per share between 20 and 23 January 2025, for a total transaction value of IDR 1.35 billion. After the transaction, Hasmoro’s ownership rose from 4.714% to approximately 4.72% of the company’s shares.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Targets 5% YoY Growth in New Contract Value for 2025
tickerNews.content: PT PP’s Company Secretary Joko Raharjo said the company targets a +5% year-on-year increase in new contract value for 2025. PT PP has not disclosed its 2024 new-contract value; however, as of the first eleven months of 2024, new-contract value reached approximately IDR 26.2 trillion, a 13.4% decline YoY, covering only 81.7% of the 2024 target of IDR 32 trillion.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Director Buys 25 Million Shares at IDR 100
tickerNews.content: VKTR Technology Mobility’s President Director Gilarsi Wahju Setijono bought 25 million VKTR shares at an average price of IDR 100 per share on 22 January 2025, for a total transaction value of roughly IDR 2.5 billion. After the transaction, Gilarsi’s ownership rose from zero to 0.05% of the company’s shares.
